data.text:
Names of Colours – List of Colours Names in English

Last Updated : 18 Mar, 2024

Improve

Names of Colors: We live in a colorful world. Look around you, every little thing has a color of its own. While growing up as children, we are taught about many colors, like white, black, red, green, blue, etc. But there are many more colors than these. Color is an aspect of the object that may be described in terms of hue, lightness & saturation. The visual color reflects the light from the object to the retina of the eyes. Colors are identified by the eyes because the thing reflects the wavelength of light, so the color bounces to our eyes, & when light shines on an object, some colors bounce off them & travel with the wavelength.

Usually, we learn the names of colors, by associating them with the colors of the objects. These days, activities are also conducted, where the names of the colors are written with different colors & students are asked to identify the color in which the word is written & not the word itself (a color name). This is an activity that not only teaches colour names to kids but also improves their reasoning skills.

Colors are used for identifying both animate & inanimate objects around us. We need to learn the names of different colors, this will be helpful to us.

Colors

Colors, is also spelled as colours. Color is an aspect of the object that may be described in terms of hue, lightness & saturation. In physics, the term color is linked with electromagnetic radiation having various wavelengths & intensities, visible from the human naked eye. The visual color reflects the light from the object to the retina of the eyes. Colors are identified by the eyes because the thing reflects the wavelength of light, so the colour bounces to our eyes, & when light shines on an object, some colors bounce off them & travel with the wavelength.

Types of Colors

Three basic types of colors are :

Three Primary Colors: Blue, Red, and Yellow

Three Secondary Colors: Violet, Orange, and Green

Six Tertiary Colors: Blue-Violet, Red-Violet, Yellow-Green, Red-Orange, Yellow-Orange, Blue-Green

List of Names of Colors

All Different Colors Name

Red is present at the end of the visible spectrum of light. It is associated with love, hatred, anger, war, danger, heat, etc.

Blue is a basic color. It expresses stability, inspiration & wisdom.

Green color symbolizes the natural beauty of the world. It often represents good luck, health & jealousy. It is said to improve the reading ability of human eyes.

Orange is a color of a combination of yellow & red. It is an energetic color that shows excitement, warmth & enthusiasm.

White color represents innocence, purity, peace & politeness. It is also a color of balance, harmony & courage.

Black is associated with darkness & negativity. It is also tied to death & evilness. It’s associated with style. Wearing black suits implies professionalism & seriousness. It is mostly worn by businessmen/women.

Yellow color is the most luminous among all colors. The yellow color catches attention from a far distance. It denotes optimism, enlightenment, happiness, politeness, creativity & shining.

Purple color, also known as the rich color, shows royalty, luxury, ambition, power & nobility. It has the most powerful wavelength.

Silver color is associated with ores’ meaning, raw materials of industries, ornate, glamorous & is sophisticated.

Brown color is a natural color that shows strength & reliability. It can also show feelings of isolation, depression & loneliness.

Gray is a cool, simple & balanced color. It is an emotionless color, which is usually associated with dullness, it can be formal & conservative. Gray shows a loss of depression & timelessness.

Pink color is linked with love, femininity, or kindness. It’s mostly loved by girls, making it a feminine color, which brings romance.

Olive is a yellowish-green color that is mostly used in the making of military suits & weapons. It is a symbol of harmony & peace, which signifies perception, empathy & space for human mankind.

Maroon is used to express passionate & intense things such as love risk, excitement, strength & beauty.

Violet is a color made out of red & blue. It is similar to purple color & is also a symbol of royalty, prosperity, wealth & richness. It shows the performance of dignity & calmness.

Charcoal– The grey color is similar to charcoal color, associated with loss & depression. The charcoal grey color represents the strength of black & the mystery of the color silver. It lacks negativity & shows calmness.

Magenta shows universal harmony, emotional balance, compassion, happiness, contentment, appreciation & kindness. It contains the power & passion of red & a restrained form of energy.

Bronze is similar to brown in color. It’s associated with strength, growth & experience related to nature.

Cream is a simple or pale yellow hue, a white color mixed with a slight yellow color. It denotes a neutral, calm & relaxing moment.

Gold color is associated with love, compassion, magic, wisdom, wealth, prosperity & happiness.

Tan color is a pale shade of brown. It denotes warmth & security. It is a brownish-yellow color combination & also a green shade of orange.

Mustard is related to the darker shade of yellow color & is used mostly to design the interiors of the house.

Navy Blue color is a dark shade of blue color, it represents yachting sport & it looks like a black color in the dark. It is used mostly in the navy army, their suits, armor, all war stuff & weapons.

Lavender color is used to signify medicinal properties & is also valuable to the antiseptic. It’s also associated with relaxation, purity & cleanliness.

Coral color is a combination of two colors, pink & orange. It has specific characteristics of orange, which shows warmth, energy & feminism.

Rust is the name of the color after the resulting phenomenon of oxidation process occurs on the iron surface when it comes into contact with water or moisture containing oxygen. It looks reddish in color. When it dries, it looks like a slant orange color too.

Peach is the color of the interior flesh of the peach fruit. It’s mostly used in interior designs.

Burgundy color is a dark shade of red color & a purplish tinge. It shows power, wealth & seriousness.

Mauve color shows a positive compression tone, kind, friendly & generous.

Teal color has a relaxing property. It describes open communication & perception.

FAQs on the Names of Colors

List some color names starting with ‘B’.

Answer-

Blue, Black, Brown & Bronze are names of colors starting with ‘B’.

List some color names starting with ‘G’.

Answer-

Gold, Grey & Green are names of colors starting with ‘G’.

List some color names starting with ‘P’.

Answer-

Pink, Peach, Pearl & Plum are names of colors starting with ‘P’.

What are the three basic types of colors ?

Answer-

The three basic types of colors are: Three Primary Colors: Blue, Red, Yellow

Three Secondary Colors: Violet, Orange, Green

Six Tertiary Colors: Blue-Violet, Red-Violet, Yellow-Green, Red-Orange, Yellow-Orange, Blue-Green

Name some common colors for kids.

Answer-

Blue, Yellow, Red, Green, Orange are some common colors for kids.
